document.masterDocTitle: Staphylinidae (Insecta: Coleoptera) in Latin America: synopsis, annotated catalog, diversity and distribution

mods:titleInfo.mods:title: Staphylinidae (Insecta: Coleoptera) in Latin America: synopsis, annotated catalog, diversity and distribution

bibRefCitation.author: Sharp, D. S.
bibRefCitation.refString: Sharp, D. S. (1884) Biologia Centrali-Americana, Insecta, Coleoptera, Staphylinidae. 1 (2), 313 - 392, pls. 8 - 9.

bibRefCitation.author: Blackwelder, R. E.

bibRefCitation.author: Dejean, P. F. M. A.
bibRefCitation.refString: Dejean, P. F. M. A. (1833) Catalogue des coleopteres de la collection de M. le comte Dejean [2 nd. edition], livr. 1, pp. 1 - 96. Paris.

bibRefCitation.author: Portevin, G.
bibRefCitation.refString: Portevin, G. (1929) Histoire naturelle australisch-polynesischen des Coleopteres de France. Tome I. Adephaga, Polyphaga: Staphylinoidea. Encyclopedie Entomologique (A), Vol. 12, Lechevalier, Paris. xii + 649 pp., pls. 1 - 5.

subSubSection.paragraph:
Type species:
Quedius riparius F. Kellner, 1843

Type species:
Quedius riparius F. Kellner, 1843
32 species are included in this genus from Central and South America.
South America: Colombia , Venezuela , Peru , Bolivia , Paraguay , Chile , Argentina .
Other regions: Nearctic, Palaearctic, Ethiopian, Oriental , Australian, Oceanic.
